list.name: Gotron
list.about: Gotron, also known as The Jerry Games, is a parody of the popular TV show 'American Gladiators.' In the episode 'Gotron Jerrysis Rickvangelion,' the character Gotron is a massive mech suit controlled by Jerrys from different dimensions. The concept is a playful reference to the competitive nature of Jerrys across the multiverse, emphasizing their often underestimated abilities. It's a humorous take on the Jerry character, showcasing their potential in an action-packed spectacle.

list.name: Young Jerry
list.about: Young Jerry, as depicted in the episode 'Rixty Minutes,' represents the younger version of Jerry Smith from an alternate reality. Interestingly, the episode features improvised interdimensional cable TV shows, and one of the segments reveals Young Jerry's embarrassing bathroom incident. This amusing snippet not only highlights Jerry's character flaws but also adds a touch of comedy to the series, reminding viewers of the unpredictable and bizarre nature of Rick and Morty's adventures.

list.name: Young Beth
list.about: Young Beth, introduced in the episode 'Rixty Minutes,' offers a glimpse into the past of Beth Smith, Rick's daughter. In one of the interdimensional cable TV shows, there is a segment where Young Beth finds a wild deer and brings it home as a pet. However, things take a dark turn when the deer accidentally causes significant destruction in their house. This hilarious incident showcases the reckless nature of Young Beth and serves as a reminder of the unexpected twists and turns that occur in the show's unconventional storytelling.

list.name: Young Beth
list.about: Young Beth, portrayed in the episode 'Rixty Minutes,' represents a version of Beth Smith from an alternate reality. In one of the improvised interdimensional cable TV segments, Young Beth has a heartwarming moment where she serenades her pet cat, named Mr. Whiskers, with a beautiful song. This sweet and endearing scene adds depth to Beth's character, showcasing her softer side and providing a touching contrast to the often chaotic and dark themes explored in Rick and Morty.

list.name: Young Jerry
list.about: Young Jerry, featured in the episode 'Rixty Minutes,' is a younger iteration of Jerry Smith from an alternate reality. In one of the interdimensional cable TV shows, there is a segment where Young Jerry mistakenly walks into a glass door, resulting in a comical and embarrassing moment. This scene serves as a lighthearted reminder of Jerry's occasional clumsiness and gullibility, contributing to the show's overall humor and satirical commentary on human behavior.

list.name: Butter Robot
list.about: The Butter Robot, introduced in the episode 'Something Ricked This Way Comes,' is a creation of Rick Sanchez. Its sole purpose is to pass butter, which leads to existential despair when it realizes its limited existence. This depiction of the Butter Robot reflects the series' tendency to explore existential themes in a humorous and thought-provoking manner. It highlights the show's ability to blend comedy and introspection, questioning the meaning and purpose behind even the simplest of tasks.
